result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM Defendant Andrew John Sullivan in court, in custody.  Attorney Nils Wyosnick in court for Andrew John Sullivan.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Lippert put agreement on record.  Defendant to withdraw plea in 20CF160 and then plead to other cases.  Court stated plea withdrawal needs to have briefs filed to see legal basis and reasoning.  Defense requested 30 days to file brief due 11-28-22 and  ADA Lippert brief due 12-13-22.    Reply -none needed. Court will set hearing after briefs received.    Atty Wyosnick informed court of jury trial set in 20CF194 on November 18. 2022.  Court removed from jury trial calendar for 11-18-22.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights filed be Atty Wyonsnick
Plea and Sentencing 10/26/22 at 9:30 AM

filed by Attorney Wyosnick
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:15 AM Cases called: 20CF160, 20TR1978, 21CF543, and 22CF262. Defendant Andrew John Sullivan in court, in custody from Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Nils Wyosnick in court for Andrew John Sullivan.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wyosnick updated the court on the status of the cases. Requested to proceed with entering a waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF262 and a plea hearing on 20CF160 today, with an adjournment of all matters to be set for plea/sentencing hearing on all matters with a global. State agreed. In 22CF262 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty plea entered.  In 20CF160: Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1 Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 & 3 dismissed. Sentencing to be held at later date. Bond is revoked pending sentencing on 20CF160. All cases will be included in the plea/sentencing hearing. 10:30 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
